intro: Eugenia caudatilimba, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or red mangabey, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically red when mature, often used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Its ornamental value and fruit make it a popular plant in horticulture and traditional medicine.
